cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest overnight, then move northward through the lower Mississippi Valley and into the mid-Mississippi Valley by Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (near Intracoastal City–Morgan City)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Mouth of Mississippi River to Grand Isle LA and Intracoastal City to Cameron LA; Tropical-Storm Watch east of the Mouth of the Pearl River to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Intracoastal City to Grand Isle LA; Tropical-Storm Warning Mouth of Pearl River to Grand Isle, Lakes Pontchartrain/Maurepas, Intracoastal City to Cameron
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from eastern Texas coast eastward across Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Only occasional gusts below tropical-storm force expected when remnant depression passes Tuesday
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of remnant tropical rainfall possible Tuesday–Wednesday, locally higher in thunderstorms
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief river level rises on the Missouri River could delay barge operations, but no major flooding currently anticipated
